page.title: 08COMMUNITY CENTRE - N.ROMFORD
page.content: The Community Centre was built in November, 1965. The land where the centre is was a row of Collier's houses, a forest and then an adventrue playground. The council and the Community Association paid for it to be built. Most of the staff are volunteers,but the caretaker and cleaning ladies get paid. They get up to 17,000 visitors a year and betwen 60 and 80 a night. The people who go there range from 4 years to 80 years of age. It is closed on Bank Holidays. To join the Community Association costs Â£4 for a single person, Â£2 for a pensioner and Â£6 for a family. In Autumn 1982, the sports hall was built at a cost of Â£189,000. The association runs many activities ranging from ballet to badminton.
